snippet: Sen. Feinstein today provided stark evidence that the C.I.A. may have committed crimes to prevent the exposure of brutal interrogation practices.
abstract: Editorial praises Sen Dianne Feinstein for providing stark and convincing evidence that the Central Intelligence Agency may have committed crimes to prevent disclosing to Congress its brutal interrogation practices; maintains that fog surrounding CIA detentions persists because of Pres Obama's decision not to investigate them; urges Obama to act in favor of disclosure and accountability.
lead_paragraph: Sen. Feinstein today provided stark evidence that the C.I.A. may have committed crimes to prevent the exposure of brutal interrogation practices.
